intro: Aulaxis micranthifolia, commonly known as the small-flowered aulaxis, is a herbaceous plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a mild, spicy scent. Aulaxis micranthifolia is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
